alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 31 at 12:56PM CDT until November 01 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT TODAY FOR SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND PORTIONS OF INTERIOR SOUTHWESTERN ALABAMA AND A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT AREAWIDE WEDNESDAY DUE TO CRITICALLY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES COMBINED WITH GUSTY NORTHERLY WINDS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND INTERIOR SOUTHWESTERN ALABAMA... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 051, 052, 053, 054, 055, 067, 075, 076, 078 and 079. * WINDS...North 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For the first Red Flag Warning, values as low as 24 percent. For the second Red Flag Warning, values as low as 15 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and persistent severe to extreme drought intensity over the local area can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
